website_summaries.verdict: The Oppo Find X2 Pro boasts an amazing screen and a powerful camera, but it doesn't do enough to distinguish itself from flagship phones.
For pure performance, the Find X2 Pro can’t be beat right now, but you'll have to pay for it - and miss out on wireless charging.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon no longer trust you
customer_reviews.text: I received this way very sad because I trust Amazon and I have a product that has a defect and I want a compensation for it
customer_reviews.author: lama

customer_reviews.title: WOW! amazing phone.
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing phone! i bought a Neo last week, and was so impressed that i have sold that to a friend who was going to order one, and ive upgraded to the Pro as i knew it was going to be an absolute machine. nice to see a eco friendly 'vegan' leather backing, nice to have something different for once. The battery charges so quick, 38 minutes to full charge! and lasts all day with good usage, very impressed so far, super fast and responsive and the screen quality whilst watching Netflix challenged my 4k TV at home! definitely suggest this if you dont want to go with the generic brand leaders, best phone ive ever had hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Master Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: An amazing phone, which definitely gets 5* from me
customer_reviews.text: An amazing phone, which definitely gets 5* from me. The charge time is impressive. I unboxed the device earlier and it was fully charged before I could even finish my lunch - SuperVOOC is a real game changer. The camera quality is stunning. The device takes really clear and sharp images with lots of detail and replaces the need for me to carry a physical camera. The quality of the product feels very premium and definitely challenges all other premium devices available. I would highly recommend the phone and it is nice to use a device with some real innovation :)

I was looking for a next generation Huawei p30 pro replacement ever since they lost Google play store and for me this is it. Love it.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought a Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as good as the Samsung Note I had before...quite often struggles to deal with a lot of things being done at once -- gets slow and freezes. Also just tons of little settings and features that are way better on a top of the range Samsung. I dont use GBoard and the Android dictionary suggestions won't turn off, which is extremely annoying. On the whole it's fine; I like the size and shape, which is quite slim. Being able to use comfortably with one hand is a big plus. And there's tons of storage space. But so far from being worth the money that I really regret the buy.

customer_reviews.text: I've only had a few hours to go through the OS and install my Google profile etc. But What I can say is that the screen, stereo speakers are exceptional. I purchased the black ceramic variant as it fits the darkmode aesthetic.
